meanings.sent1: The material was deemed nonfissionable due to its stable nature.
meanings.sent2: Scientists confirmed that the substance was nonfissionable and posed no risk.
meanings.sent3: The nonfissionable element sat peacefully in the laboratory, unaffected by the experiments.
meanings.sent4: Her resolve was as nonfissionable as the strongest metal, unwavering in the face of challenges.
meanings.sent5: The concept of time being nonfissionable like a solid rock helped him understand its unchangeable nature.

meanings.definition: Unable to be split into smaller parts through nuclear fission.
meanings.sent1: The nonfissionable material remained whole even under extreme conditions.
meanings.sent2: The researchers discovered a new nonfissionable element in the reactor.
meanings.sent3: The nonfissionable atoms refused to break apart, much to the frustration of the scientists.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was like a nonfissionable bond, unbreakable and strong.
meanings.sent5: The idea of trust being nonfissionable like a diamond made her value it even more.
